name: PH_2_5_8_Maintain_Family_History
title: PH.2.5.8 Maintain Family History (Function)
description: Manage the PHR Account Holder's Family Health History.
purpose: The family history traditionally imparts the PHR Account Holder with certain risks and probabilities of illnesses that have a familial component. The major illnesses and cause of death of primary family members should be captured and displayed. For some illnesses of the PHR Account Holder a negative family history is also pertinent such as for cancer.

statement.label: PH.2.5.8#01
statement.requirement: The system SHALL provide the ability to manage family history according to organizational policy and/or jurisdictional law.

statement.label: PH.2.5.8#02
statement.requirement: The system SHOULD provide the ability to capture, maintain, and transmit a request-for-correction to family history that was captured from an external source. Note: There could be multiple types of errors, both unintentional and intentional; the errors could also reside in multiple storage locations (primary, secondary, and intermediary); the errors could also reside in current records or in archived records; there could also be multiple sources (author, custodian-of-record, transcriptionist).

statement.label: PH.2.5.8#03
statement.requirement: The system SHOULD provide the ability for the PHR Account Holder to annotate the family history with text comments (e.g., "Great-grandmother Alice was lost at sea‚Äù and that "Uncle Robert disagrees with the cause-of-death attributed to great-grandmother Alice".)

statement.label: PH.2.5.8#04
statement.requirement: The system SHALL provide the ability to enter missing information regarding the family history.

statement.label: PH.2.5.8#05
statement.requirement: The system MAY provide the ability to exchange family history entries with the PHR Accounts of other family members according to user preference and/or consent, user role, organizational policy, and/or jurisdictional law.
